element.short: Information about an individual or animal receiving health care services
element.definition: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

element.short: Organization that issued id (may be just text)
element.comments: The reference may be just a text description of the assigner.

element.short: Organization that is associated with the contact
element.definition: Organization on behalf of which the contact is acting or for which the contact is working.
element.requirements: For guardians or business related contacts, the organization is relevant.

element.short: This patient is known to be an animal (non-human)
element.definition: This patient is known to be an animal.
element.comments: The animal element is labeled "Is Modifier" since patients may be non-human. Systems SHALL either handle patient details appropriately (e.g. inform users patient is not human) or reject declared animal records.   The absense of the animal element does not imply that the patient is a human. If a system requires such a positive assertion that the patient is human, an extension will be required.  (Do not use a species of homo-sapiens in animal species, as this would incorrectly infer that the patient is an animal).
element.requirements: Many clinical systems are extended to care for animal patients as well as human.

element.comments: This may be the primary care provider (in a GP context), or it may be a patient nominated care manager in a community/disablity setting, or even organization that will provide people to perform the care provider roles.  This is not to be used to record Care Teams, these should be recorded on either the CarePlan or EpisodeOfCare resources.

element.short: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record
element.definition: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record.
element.comments: There is only one managing organization for a specific patient record. Other organizations will have their own Patient record, and may use the Link property to join the records together (or a Person resource which can include confidence ratings for the association).
element.requirements: Need to know who recognizes this patient record, manages and updates it.

element.short: The other patient resource that the link refers to
element.definition: The other patient resource that the link refers to.
